item.title: Feed 1
item.description: Nic and Tristan Puehse, twin teen skateboarding phenoms, gave up boards two years ago and have set their sites on becoming doubles tennis champions; brothers say they became bored with skateboarding, which they had done since age 6.

item.title: Feed 2
item.description: Neighborhood Joint column on Park Delicatessen, deli-themed florist and skateboard shop in Crown Heights, Brooklyn, that attracts unconventional clientele with its unconventional wares

item.title: Feed 3
item.description: Street skateboarding is thriving in New York City, despite dangers of navigating city streets; recent fatal accidents in the Bronx and Queens have not deterred traffic-dodging riders of longboards in city.

item.title: Feed 4
item.description: Aidan Campbell comes through with the newest clip for the Thunder 149IIs. Check out the clip and interview with Aidan

item.title: Feed 5
item.description: Riverside Skate Park, which had fallen into disrepair, was designed in 1990s by New York skateboarding pioneer Andy Kessler, who died in 2009; friends of Kessler took on refurbishing project in his honor.

item.title: Feed 6
item.description: Street League, whose Super Crown World Championship will be broadcast live on ESPN2, has elevated street skateboarding contests to dizzying new heights; many skateboarders, mindful of the sport’s counter-cultural roots, would prefer that skateboarding retain its sideshow identity; others argue that skateboarding is not a sport at all and should not be treated as if it were basketball or football.

item.title: Feed 7
item.description: Some New Yorkers skateboard to work as a stay-fit strategy for health. street skateboarding contests to dizzying new heights; many skateboarders, mindful of the sport’s counter-cultural roots, would prefer that skateboarding retain its sideshow identity; others argue that skateboarding is not a sport at all and should not be treated as if it were basketball or football.
